Principal.definition: being the main or most important

1.definition: a participant in an action or transaction esp. having control or authority [theof a business]

sub_terms.a: one who engages another to act for him or her subject to his or her general control or instructionone from whom an agent derives authority to act compare
sub_terms.b: one who commits a crime or instigates, encourages, or assists another to commit it esp. when constructively or actually present see also

2.definition: a capital sum earning interest, due as a debt, or used as a fund [shall receive the income from the trust until age 18, and thereafter the ] [payments shall be applied first to interest and then to ]the main body of an estate, devise, or bequest

principal in the first degree.definition: a principal under common law who intentionally commits and is actually or constructively present at the commission of a crime

principal in the second degree.definition: a principal under common law who aids, encourages, or commands another to commit a crime and is actually or constructively present when it is committed

sub_terms.c: the person primarily liable on a legal obligation or one who will ultimately bear the burden because of a duty to indemnify another as distinguished from one (as an endorser, surety, or guarantor) who is secondarily liable
